channel.title: CVE Feed for Apple -- watchOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apple -- watchOS

item.title: CVE-2024-44206|2024-10-24T18:04:30.839Z -- apple -- watchos
item.description: An issue in the handling of URL protocols was addressed with improved logic. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.6, visionOS 1.3, Safari 17.6, watchOS 10.6, iOS 17.6 and iPadOS 17.6, macOS Sonoma 14.6. A user may be able to bypass some web content restrictions.

item.title: CVE-2024-44185|2024-10-24T18:14:12.379Z -- apple -- watchos
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.6, visionOS 1.3, Safari 17.6, watchOS 10.6, iOS 17.6 and iPadOS 17.6, macOS Sonoma 14.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash.

item.title: CVE-2024-27814|2024-06-11T19:06:32.639Z -- apple -- watchos
item.description: This issue was addressed through improved state management. This issue is fixed in watchOS 10.5. A person with physical access to a device may be able to view contact information from the lock screen.

item.title: CVE-2024-27814|2024-08-02T00:41:55.425Z -- apple -- watchos
item.description: This issue was addressed through improved state management. This issue is fixed in watchOS 10.5. A person with physical access to a device may be able to view contact information from the lock screen.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.6, visionOS 1.3, Safari 17.6, watchOS 10.6, iOS 17.6 and iPadOS 17.6, macOS Sonoma 14.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash.
